findings: ST-Elevation in leads V1, V2, V3, V4 (Anterior Leads), Reciprocal ST depression in II/III/aVF, Loss of R waves in V3, Hyperacute T waves in V2-V4
interpretation: Acute Anterior Wall STEMI - likely LAD occlusion

findings: Ejection Fraction: 42% (reduced), Regional wall motion abnormalities: Akinesis in LAD territory (anterior wall & apex), No significant valve abnormalities, No pericardial effusion
interpretation: Reduced ejection fraction with anterior wall motion abnormalities consistent with acute myocardial infarction

findings: LAD: 100% occlusion in proximal segment (TIMI 0 pre-PCI, TIMI 3 post-PCI), LCX: 40% stenosis, RCA: Mild diffuse disease, Intervention: Primary PCI performed with DES placement
interpretation: Complete LAD occlusion successfully treated with primary PCI and stent placement

findings: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality. Lungs clear bilaterally.
interpretation: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality detected on initial chest X-ray

interpretation: Sinus tachycardia likely compensatory for severe anemia

findings: Hyperdynamic left ventricle with normal ejection fraction (65%), Mild mitral regurgitation (physiologic), No structural abnormalities
interpretation: Compensatory hyperdynamic circulation secondary to severe anemia

interpretation: Multiple uterine fibroids likely contributing to heavy menstrual bleeding and iron deficiency

findings: Acute hypodense area in left middle cerebral artery territory (frontal and temporal lobes), ASPECTS score: 8, No hemorrhage, No midline shift, Chronic microvascular changes in white matter
interpretation: Acute left MCA territory infarction - candidate for thrombolysis if within time window

findings: Left MCA M1 segment occlusion, Patent carotid arteries bilaterally with mild atherosclerotic changes, Patent vertebrobasilar system
interpretation: Left MCA M1 occlusion - large vessel occlusion stroke

findings: Atrial fibrillation with ventricular rate 88 bpm, Left ventricular hypertrophy pattern, No acute ST-T changes
interpretation: Atrial fibrillation - likely cardioembolic source of stroke
